CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 14, 1961, pg. 1, reads: "'Don't Cross This Line!' - This is the plea of these members of the NAACP Youth Council, who for the past three Saturdays, have been picketing shoe stores on downtown Fifth Ave., which do not employ Negro salesmen. Shown in foreground, leading the youthful crusaders, are Mrs. Dorothy K. Williams, adviser to the group, and John Brice [sic] of the Steelworkers' Minute Men Association, who offered the youngsters protection and encouragement. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: NAACP Youth Council group, including Dorothy Williams in dark dress on left, and John Grice on left, marching on Fifth Avenue in front of Beck's Shoe Store and Candy - Rama, holding signs reading "Don't patronize Fifth Avenue Shoe Stores," Downtown
